const arr2 = [2, 44, 1, 0, -22, 56, -78];

function quickSort2(arr) {
  if (arr.length === 0) return arr;
  const pivot = arr.pop(); // ä½¿ç”¨æœ€åä¸€ä¸ªå…ƒç´ å½“ä½œåŸºå‡†æ•°
  const left = [],
    right = [];
  for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {
    if (arr[i] < pivot) left.push(arr[i]); // å°äºåŸºå‡†æ•°åˆ™æ”¾åˆ°left
    else right.push(arr[i]); // å¤§äºåŸºå‡†æ•°åˆ™æ”¾åˆ°right
  }
  // åˆå¹¶leftçš„å¿«æ’ç»“æœï¼ŒåŸºå‡†æ•°å’Œå³ä¾§çš„å¿«æ’ç»“æœ
  return quickSort2(left).concat(pivot, quickSort2(right));
}

console.log(quickSort2(arr2));

æ·±æ‹·è´

function deepClone(obj) {
  let result;
  if (typeof obj == "object") {
    result = isArray(obj) ? [] : {}; // ç©ºå¯¹è±¡æ¥æ”¶
    for (let i in obj) {
      result[i] =
        isObject(obj[i]) || isArray(obj[i]) ? deepClone(obj[i]) : obj[i];
    }
  } else {
    result = obj;
  }
  return result;
}

function isObject(obj) {
  return Object.prototype.toString.call(obj) == "[object Object]";
}

function isArray(obj) {
  return Object.prototype.toString.call(obj) == "[object Array]";
}

// æ–¹æ³•1
const debounce = function (fn, delay) {
  let timer = null; // é—­åŒ…ç»´æŠ¤ä¸€ä¸ªtimer
  return (...args) => {
    clearTimeout(timer);
    timer = setTimeout(() => {
      fn?.apply(this, args);
    }, delay);
  };
};

// æµ‹è¯•

let biu = function () {
  console.log("biu biu biu", new Date().getTime());
};
let boom = function () {
  console.log("boom boom boom", new Date().getTime());
};

var a = setInterval(debounce(biu, 500), 1000);
var b = setInterval(debounce(boom, 2000), 1000);
setTimeout(() => {
  clearInterval(a);
  clearInterval(b);
}, 10000);

èŠ‚æµ

const throttle = (fn, delay = 500) => {
  let allow = true;

  return (...args) => {
    if (!allow) return;
    allow = false;

    setTimeout(() => {
      fn.apply(this, args);
      allow = true;
    }, delay);
  };
};

Function.prototype.myCall = function (context) {
  var context = context || window;
  context.fn = this;

  var args = [];
  for (var i = 1, len = arguments.length; i < len; i++) {
    args.push("arguments[" + i + "]");
  }
  var result = eval("context.fn(" + args + ")");

  delete context.fn;

  return result;
};

Function.prototype.myApply = function (context, arr) {
  var context = context || window;
  context.fn = this;

  var result;

  if (!arr) {
    // æ²¡æœ‰å‚æ•°
    result = context.fn();
  } else {
    // æœ‰å‚æ•°
    var args = [];

    for (let i = 0, len = arr.length; i < len; i++) {
      args.push("arr[" + i + "]");
    }

    result = eval("context.fn(" + args + ")");
  }

  delete context.fn;
  return result;
};

var testAry = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9];
var newAry = [];

testAry.forEach((item, i) => {
  let n = Number(item);
  if (n % 2 == 0) {
    newAry.push(n);
  } else {
    newAry.unshift(n);
  }
});

console.log(newAry); //["9","7","5","3","1","2","4","6"]

å®ç°ä¸€ä¸ª compare å‡½æ•°ï¼Œæ¯”è¾ƒä¸¤ä¸ªå¯¹è±¡æ˜¯å¦ç›¸åŒ

è§

//å®šä¹‰ä¸€ä¸ªæ·±åº¦å¯¹æ¯”æ–¹æ³•
function deepCompare(x, y) {
  //å£°æ˜æ‰€éœ€å˜é‡
  var i, l, leftChain, rightChain;
  //å…·ä½“å¯¹æ¯”å‡½æ•°
  function compare2Objects(x, y) {
    var p;

    // è®°å¾— NaN === NaN è¿”å› false
    // isNaN(undefined) returns true
    if (
      isNaN(x) &&
      isNaN(y) &&
      typeof x === "number" &&
      typeof y === "number"
    ) {
      return true;
    }

    // Compare primitives and functions.
    // Check if both arguments link to the same object.
    // Especially useful on the step where we compare prototypes
    if (x === y) {
      return true;
    }

    // Works in case when functions are created in constructor.
    // Comparing dates is a common scenario. Another built-ins?
    // We can even handle functions passed across iframes
    if (
      (typeof x === "function" && typeof y === "function") ||
      (x instanceof Date && y instanceof Date) ||
      (x instanceof RegExp && y instanceof RegExp) ||
      (x instanceof String && y instanceof String) ||
      (x instanceof Number && y instanceof Number)
    ) {
      return x.toString() === y.toString();
    }

    // At last checking prototypes as good as we can
    if (!(x instanceof Object && y instanceof Object)) {
      return false;
    }

    if (x.isPrototypeOf(y) || y.isPrototypeOf(x)) {
      return false;
    }

    if (x.constructor !== y.constructor) {
      return false;
    }

    if (x.prototype !== y.prototype) {
      return false;
    }

    // Check for infinitive linking loops
    if (leftChain.indexOf(x) > -1 || rightChain.indexOf(y) > -1) {
      return false;
    }

    // Quick checking of one object being a subset of another.
    // todo: cache the structure of arguments[0] for performance
    for (p in y) {
      if (y.hasOwnProperty(p) !== x.hasOwnProperty(p)) {
        return false;
      } else if (typeof y[p] !== typeof x[p]) {
        return false;
      }
    }

    for (p in x) {
      if (y.hasOwnProperty(p) !== x.hasOwnProperty(p)) {
        return false;
      } else if (typeof y[p] !== typeof x[p]) {
        return false;
      }

      switch (typeof x[p]) {
        case "object":
        case "function":
          leftChain.push(x);
          rightChain.push(y);

          if (!compare2Objects(x[p], y[p])) {
            return false;
          }

          leftChain.pop();
          rightChain.pop();
          break;

        default:
          if (x[p] !== y[p]) {
            return false;
          }
          break;
      }
    }

    return true;
  }

  if (arguments.length < 1) {
    return true; //Die silently? Don't know how to handle such case, please help...
    // throw "Need two or more arguments to compare";
  }

  for (i = 1, l = arguments.length; i < l; i++) {
    leftChain = []; //Todo: this can be cached
    rightChain = [];

    if (!compare2Objects(arguments[0], arguments[i])) {
      return false;
    }
  }

  return true;
}

function myNew() {
  let obj = new Object();

  let func = [].shift.call(arguments); //å‡ºåˆ—ï¼Œè·å–ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå‚æ•°
  obj.__proto__ = func.prototype; //protoæŒ‡å‘åŸå‹

  func.apply(obj, arguments); //è®©objæ‰§è¡Œfuncå‡½æ•°

  return obj;
}

function instance_of(L, R) {
  var O = R.prototype; // å–Rçš„æ˜¾ç¤ºåŸå‹
  L = L.__proto__; // å–Lçš„éšå¼åŸå‹

  while (true) {
    // æ­»å¾ªç¯ï¼Œç»“æŸæ¡ä»¶ï¼šè¦ä¹ˆæ‰¾åˆ°ï¼Œè¦ä¹ˆæ²¡æ‰¾åˆ°
    if (L === null) return false;

    if (O === L) {
      // è¿™é‡Œé‡ç‚¹ï¼šå½“Oä¸¥æ ¼ç­‰äºLæ—¶ï¼Œè¿”å›true
      return true;
    }
    L = L.__proto__;
  }
}

å®ç° event bus

class EventBus {
  constructor() {
    this.events = {};
  }
  // ç›‘å¬ï¼Œç»™å¯¹è±¡æ·»åŠ æ–¹æ³•
  on(name, callback) {
    const { events } = this;
    if (!events[name]) {
      events[name] = [];
    }
    events[name].push(callback);
  }
  // å–å‡ºæ¥æ‰§è¡Œ
  emit(name, ...args) {
    const handlers = this.events[name];
    handlers &&
      handlers.forEach((fn) => {
        fn.apply(this, args);
      });
  }
  // è§£é™¤
  off(name, callback) {
    const { events } = this;
    if (!events[name]) return;
    events[name] = events[name].filter((fn) => fn !== callback);
  }
  //  ç”¨å®Œç«‹é©¬ã€è§£é™¤
  once(name, callback) {
    const handler = function () {
      callback.apply(this, arguments);
      this.off(name, handler);
    };
    this.on(name, handler);
  }
  // äº‹ä»¶æ¸…ç©º
  clear() {
    this.events = {};
  }
}
